title: Add authentication to conversation viewer web server
description:
## Security: Unauthenticated Web Server Exposes All Conversation Data

**Severity:** HIGH | **Category:** auth_bypass / data_exposure | **Confidence:** 8/10

**File:** src/conversation/web-server.ts

### Problem
Conversation viewer Fastify server has zero authentication on all routes. Any client reaching the port can:
- Enumerate all conversations via /api/conversations
- Read full content (user messages, AI responses, Slack user IDs, channel IDs)
- Export conversations as markdown

CONVERSATION_VIEWER_URL config and Slack link posting confirm remote access is intended. Docker maps port 3000 externally by default.

### Exploit Scenario
1. Operator sets CONVERSATION_VIEWER_URL to public URL
2. Attacker hits GET /api/conversations to enumerate all conversation IDs
3. Reads full conversation content including credentials, internal URLs, proprietary code

### Recommendation
- Add auth middleware (Bearer token via CONVERSATION_VIEWER_TOKEN at minimum)
- Ideally integrate Slack user identity verification so only participants can view their conversations
- Consider removing the list endpoint or requiring elevated auth for it
